pr_title: Increased maximum threads allowed by stability tests.

timeline.bodyText:
Could this be a breaking change? Because the default thread pool used is https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/nio/channels/AsynchronousChannelGroup.html and customers can configure it via system properties.
Should we close the executor when the SDK client is closed? My concern is that customers might find it surprising that after the client is closed, there are still some sdk threads lingering.
timeline.author: zoewangg

replies.bodyText:
I guess someone might consider this to be breaking. It certainly wouldn't affect the majority of users, but I suppose it could affect someone. I'm willing to drop naming these threads from this change, since it was just for my ease of debugging and no customers have complained about it.
The threads will go away after 60 seconds, so they won't linger too long. That's also the current behavior.
A async request body is a separate abstraction from the client, so it can't be linked to the lifecycle of a client.
replies.author: millems

replies.bodyText: Yeah, +1 it's super difficult to debug right now. It'd also be nice if we could provide a configuration that allows customers to provide their own executors.
replies.author: zoewangg
